text.0: bedewed with holy oil and meetly worshipped the swift one vies with sūryas beam in splendour.
text.1: for him may mornings dawn without cessation who saith let us press soma out for indra.
text.2: with kindled fire and strewn grass let him worship and somapresser sing with stones adjusted.
text.3: and let the priest whose pressstones ring forth loudly go down with his oblation to the river.
text.4: this wife is coming near who loves her husband who carries to his home a vigorous consort.
text.5: here may his car seek fame here loudly thunder and his wheel make a thousand revolutions.
text.6: no troubles vex that king in whose home indra drinks the sharp soma juice with milk commingled.
text.7: with heroes he drives near he slays the foeman blest cherishing that name he guards his people.
text.8: may he support in peace and win in battle he masters both the hosts that meet together.
text.9: dear shall he be to sūrya dear to agni who with pressed soma offers gifts to india.
